episode_title: 814 - The One With The Secret Closet

content.description: The Hallway, Phoebe walks up to and knocks on Chandler and Monica’s door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, what’s up?
content.parenthetical: opens the door wearing a robe, but leaves the chain on

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I left my guitar here again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, okay. No problem.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Monica closes the door, gets the guitar, and then hands it out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! Umm…(Monica closes the door again and Phoebe knocks again.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So do you want to hang out or something?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! You kinda caught me at a bad time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh are you and Chandler…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Exactly.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Do you guys want me to play for you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. (Closes the door as Chandler walks up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Pheebs, what’s up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You ask an intriguing question Chandler Bing.
(Chandler lets her into the apartment and reveals that Monica is getting a massage from another woman.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! You’re getting a massage! You never let me massage you!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, I can explain!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You told me you hate massages!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Buy stamps, pick up dry cleaning… Don’t let Phoebe in.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe this! How long as this been going on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well umm, Alexandra has been…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it has a name?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, don’t get upset!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay—Oop! Too late! I’m leaving! Come on Chandler let’s go! (She storms out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Phoebe I thought I’d—(Off Phoebe’s look)—Yeah, what the hell. (Exits with Phoebe.)

content.description: Joey’s Bedroom, Joey is having a dream about Rachel giving birth with him as the father.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh okay, okay! One more push! One more push! Come on honey, we’re almost there! We’re almost there!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Joey, I’m so happy things worked out for us that we’re having this baby together. I love you so much.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I love you too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I hope it’s not an inappropriate time to say this but, you’re the best sex I ever had.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s always appropriate! (Back to the matter at hand) Oh, okay. One more push! One more push!
(Finally, the baby is delivered and starts crying.)

content.speaker: Doctor
content.text: Oh, here is your beautiful baby. Congratulations!
(She hands the baby to Joey who pulls down the blanket to reveal Ross’s face where the baby’s should be.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I hope you’re a better father than you’re a friend!! (Cries again and Joey wakes up in horror.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? What’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come feel this! Come feel my belly!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aaaah…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! The baby is kicking for the first time! Will you please come feel this?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!
(Joey starts to get up but stops.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, y’know what? Maybe uh, you…you should come to me. I’m a not, I’m not wearing any bottoms.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay! (She goes over to him and he feels her belly.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my, oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw, it’s unbelievable! Wow! She is kicking so much! Oh, she’s like umm…oh…who’s that kind of annoying girl soccer player?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mia Hamm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mia Hamm!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s amazing. (Drops the sheet.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh!! One hand on the sheet Joe!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-hey-oh! Sorry!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica has opened another wedding present as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey babe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi honey. We just got a wedding gift from Bob and Faye Bing; they don’t like us do they? (They gave them a pok-a-dotted punch bowl.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who says you can’t get a nice punch bowl for under six bucks? Maybe we can take it back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it doesn’t say where it came from. Where would we return it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How about to the street say from the balcony?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t we just find a place for it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. How about in that cabinet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! That’s where we keep the canned goods! Have you completely forgotten everything you learned at orientation?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How about the closet by the bathroom? (The secret green door by the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, okay. Here, why don’t you let me do it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, I will do it. Honey, you have to learn to sit down and relax and let your husband take care of things once and awhile. (Tries the door.) It’s locked, you have to help me. Why is it locked?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No reason. I-I keep private things in there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh y’know, I’ve been living here a while and I’ve never seen what’s inside that closet. What is, what is in there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Feminine stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t try to make me uncomfortable with feminine stuff!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, there is nothing in there that concerns you! If you love me you-you’ll let it go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you! (He tries the door again and Monica glares at him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Love you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello Chandler, lovely day huh? (To Monica) You!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe if it helps Alexandra has only been massaging Monica for like three years. (Phoebe rolls her eyes and walks away and Monica glares at him.) If! I said, “If it helps!” (Goes to the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why won’t you let me massage you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well it’s…I mean I’d just—I’d be self-conscious. You’re my friend; I’d be naked.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica! We lived together for years! I’ve seen you naked!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s different, we were roommates! And when?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m curious about the human body.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, come on Phoebe, you can understand why this would be weird for me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But I’m a professional! And I’m really good! Look, if you’re uncomfortable we can stop. Just give me a chance, okay. Please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, if it means that much to you…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It does! How would you feel if you couldn’t share your cooking? Or-or imagine how Ross would feel if he couldn’t teach us about dragons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dinosaurs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Potato, potaato.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Rachel are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross! The baby’s kicking!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! It is?! (He tries to quickly remove his gloves, but runs into trouble and finally throws them off of his hands like a hockey player in a fight and grabs Rachel’s belly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not kicking right now. Although we would love to see you do (Mimics him) that again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, when-when was it kicking? What happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Last night! I just felt it and I went into Joey’s room and he was sleeping…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A dreamless sleep.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God, the baby’s kicking. That’s great. Although I…kinda wish I-I would’ve been there to feel the kicking for the first time y’know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I got stuff going on in here (Rubbing his belly) if you wanna feel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I-I don’t want to miss anymore baby stuff. So…Here. Here’s my new pager number, okay? Anytime anything pregnancy related happens use it! I’ll be there! Okay? I don’t care if it’s three in the morning and all you want is ice cream.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Can I get a copy of that?

content.description: Phoebe’s Apartment, Monica is lying on the massage table waiting for Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you under the sheet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.
(Phoebe turns on some music and grabs some oil.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great, let’s begin. (She starts the massage.) How’s the pressure?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nice! Wow Phoebe you are good!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stating the obvious, but thank you. And it’s not weird is it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. Ooohh…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s right, you just enjoy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Oh yeah! Ohhhhh! Ohh! Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God Phoebe!! (Phoebe covers one ear.) Oh that’s it! That’s it! Right there! Oh! (Tries to cover the other ear.) Ooooh-oooh-ooooh… (Covers both ears and continues the massage with her elbows.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler has a box of keys and is trying them on the secret closet when someone enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wasn’t trying to open your closet! I wasn’t trying to open your closet! I swear! (Running into the kitchen and sees its Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, Monica runs a pretty tight ship over here. What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica has a secret closet and she won’t let me see what’s in it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know! What could she possibly be hiding in here that I can’t see?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. Ooh, I bet it’s Richard.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why would Monica be keeping Richard in here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well off the top of my head uhh, maybe she’s having her cake and eating it too. You being the cake and Richard being the too. Or!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And here we go…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I saw this movie once where there was a door and no one knew what was behind it, and when they finally got it open millions and millions and millions of bugs came pouring out and they feasted on human flesh. Y’know it wouldn’t kill ya to respect your wife’s privacy! (He walks away and into his apartment and looks the door.) Stupid closet full of bugs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey. Joey, something feels weird and not good weird. I don’t—Whoa!! (Winces in pain.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey whoa-whoa, don’t worry. Okay. When my sisters were pregnant they got every weird feeling in the book, it was always nothing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Absolutely. But , we’re gonna stop by the hospital just to be sure, okay? I’ll page Ross on the way. Come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Oh God—Ow!—Oo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay Rach-Rach-Rach look at me, look at me, everything’s gonna be fine, trust me. Okay. Take my hand. Here we go. (Rachel grabs his hand.) Oww crushing bones!

content.description: The Hospital, Joey is in the waiting room as Rachel comes back out with the doctor.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! So?

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: She’s fine. She’s experiencing Braxton-Hicks contractions, mild discomfort caused by contractions in the uterine wall.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm, mild discomfort. So I take it you’ve had one of these Braxton thingies?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So but everything is normal.

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: Absolutely.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And-and there’s no danger to her and the baby?

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: No-no. Contractions can be unnerving if you don’t know what they are, but she’s fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you doctor. (Dr. Long exits.) (To Joey) Oh thank you for being so nice and calm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Calm?! I wasn’t calm! I’ve never been more scared in all my life!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But wait you said everything was gonna be okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well what do I know?! I’m not a doctor!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I—But everything is okay. I’m fine!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You sure?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Yes! I got half a mind to contract that doctor’s uterus though. Mild discomfort, what’s he talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey-hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is everything okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, everything’s fine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your page said come to the hospital, what? What was it? What happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Something called Braxton-Hicks contractions.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Oh. Thank God, most women don’t even feel them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, no uterus, no opinion.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey uh, what’s with the candy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh when you beeped me I was on line at the concession stand at the movie theater.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh you went to the movies by yourself?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No I—Mona!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I gotta go back in there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Why? What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, everything’s fine. I just gotta go back…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No really, you tell me what’s up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I-I forgot my underwear. (Ross lets her go.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, thanks so much for bringing her to the hospital.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey, don’t worry about it man. Don’t worry about it, no big deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah but still, I mean it should’ve been me. I’m the dad.

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: Uh, if you have any questions, here’s some information on Braxton-Hicks. (Hands Joey a pamphlet.) Oh and by the way, you did the right thing by bringing her in. You’re gonna make a wonderful father.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, hey. Not as good as this guy! (Grabs Ross around the shoulders.) He brought Twizlers !

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Joey and Chandler are still working on the door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There has got to be a way!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Easy there Captain Kirk. Oh, do you have a bobby pin?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. (Checks his hair.) Oh no wait, I’m not an nine-year-old girl.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then why do you throw like one?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe Monica has a bobby pin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure. “Monica.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, how’s the hideously inappropriate crush on Rachel coming?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, really good. Really good. Yeah, I should be ready to kill myself any day now. (Chandler returns with a bobby pin and hands it to Joey.) Wow, you sure found that quick. (He tries the pin in the lock.) I just—I wish I didn’t feel this way about Rachel anymore, y’know? I wish things could go back to normal. I mean, I love living with her and God, helping out with the baby is just amazing, but now I think…I think Ross feels left out. Y’know? When I had to take Rachel to the hospital, the doctor thought I was the father. God… You should’ve seen the look on Ross’s face. (Pause) By the way, I have no idea what I’m doing here. For all I know I’m just locking it more. Oh hey, did you try opening it with a credit card?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a good idea.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (They switch places and Chandler gets out a credit card.) So uh, Ross is kinda bummed huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I just…I feel terrible.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s not your fault. What are you gonna do? Not take her to the hospital? Y’know? You’re doing nothing wrong. (Pause) Except for harboring an all consuming love for the woman whose carrying his baby. (He loses his card behind the door.) Richard? If-if you’re in there, could you pass me my credit card?

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is on the couch as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gotta tell you, yesterday was amazing. That massage felt so good!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, I got that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So umm, what do you say we make it a weekly appointment?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Okay but you should know though, I’ve raised my rates to $200 an hour.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I mean $500.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you make sex noises when you get massaged!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and it really freaked me out! And after a while I even tried to hurt you and it just spurred you on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You’re crazy! There’s nothing sexual about the noises I make!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? There’s nothing sexual about this? (Sexily) Oooh. Oo God! Ohh. Ohhhh. Ohh. (Some cute guy is watching closely.) (To him) What are you looking at?! (Pause) I mean hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my—This is so embarrassing. Oh my God, I’m never gonna get massaged again!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, you can’t let this stop you from getting massages! No look, I have, I have lots of clients that make the same noises you do!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well not clients, lovers. But let’s just y’know, try it again. Come back and-and we’ll work through it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! Okay, if you’ll just excuse me. (To the guy) So, did you hear something you liked?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is balancing an aluminum can on her stomach as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Ross! Check it out! I learned a new trick!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey uh, I brought you some lunch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! That’s so sweet of you! Oh yum! (Takes a bite out of the sandwich and starts to get sick.) Did you put pickles on this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross!! (Runs to the bathroom and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What?! Rach what?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I made her favorite, tuna salad with pickles.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pickle? Pickles make her sick. Giving her pickles is like giving me salad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I’m sorry Rach, I didn’t know. Are you gonna be okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’ll be fine. But could someone please make sure that sandwich is gone when I get out there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m on it! (Takes a bite out of the sandwich.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe this! I shouldn’t be the one making her throw up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude relax! It could happen to anyone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? Not to you, because you know this stuff. I don’t know any of it and I’m the father. I wish I’d be more involved y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, if anyone is keeping score, I no longer eat tuna.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey uh, can I, can I talk to you guys for a second?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, sit down. I wanna talk about our situation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you breaking up with us?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The thing is…’cause I live with Rachel I’m here for a lot of the stuff, okay? (To Rachel) And Ross…Ross is missing everything. So…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe you two should live together.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you asking me to move out? Do you not want me here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no, no-no I love living with you. It just seems that…if you’re gonna have a roommate, y’know it might as well be the father.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But Joey, I don’t think Ross wants me to move into his apartment and disrupt his life like that. I mean—(Ross turns to her with wishful eyes.)—Or he does.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No I-I-I would love to be around for you and the baby. And we-we can just try it like on a temporary basis.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But Ross, its you and me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So? Sure! But it-it wouldn’t be anything romantic. And I’m-I’m dating Mona—Damnit Mona! I was supposed to meet her like an hour ago! What is wrong with me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right now, so? What do you think?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. Is it crazy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No it’s not. Joey, this is a smart idea.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I was due.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, let’s do it. I’ll move in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh Rach that’s great. That’s great. (They hug and Joey breathes a sigh of relief.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is pounding out the hinge pins on the closet door to get it open.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not to shabby, I got this all off myself…using my wife’s tools. (He takes the door off the frame and we finally get to see what’s behind the green door! It is stacked, floor to ceiling, with junk.) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: (Gasps) How did you get in there?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re messy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no! You weren’t supposed to see this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I married Fred Sanford!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Chandler, you don’t understand! (Chandler starts singing the theme for Sanford and Son , an old TV show starring Redd Fox.) Okay! Okay! Okay! Fine! Now you know. Okay? I’m y’know…I’m sick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, honey you’re not sick! Look, I don’t love you because you’re organized, I love you in spite of that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? You promise you won’t tell anyone?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! And look, now that I know if I got some extra stuff lying around can we, can we share the closet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well…it’s just umm…I’m afraid you might mess it up.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is drinking a gallon of orange juice as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So Rachel’s all moved out huh? How are you taking it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, I wanted to have a few beers, but uh, I got rid of those because Rachel couldn’t stand the smell of them. But I have thrown back a lot of orange juice with calcium though. And uh, it’s a couple weeks past it’s expiration date, so it’s got a bit of a kick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kidding me? I’m great! Yeah, I’m uh; I’m better than great. I am good. And now that she’s gone, I can uh, I can do all this stuff around here that I couldn’t do before. Y’know? Like umm, I can walk around naked again. Y’know? I can uh, I can watch porn in the living room. Right? This is uh, this is good for me. Y’know? I like being on my own, I’m uh, better off this way. I’m uh, a lone wolf. Y’know? A loner. Alone. All alone. Forever. What’s a wolf got to do to get a huh around here?! (Chandler rushes over and hugs him.)

content.description: Phoebe’s Apartment, Phoebe is giving Monica another massage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s it. Just relax.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh. Oh! Ohh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on more!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you like that don’t you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah right there!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You want it there? You take it there baby!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, say my name. Say it! (She stops when she realizes what she’s doing.) And now I’m going to cover you back up, and umm we’re never doing this again.
